newsitem.title: USA: CSCE cocoa called to S5 to $10 a tonne lower.
newsitem.headline: CSCE cocoa called to S5 to $10 a tonne lower.

text.p: CSCE cocoa futures were called to open $5 to $10 per tonne lower on Wednesday, after early gains on the London market were erased, traders said.

London cocoa futures were barely changed in thin, rangebound trading early Wednesday, after an early run-up proved to be shortlived. LIFFE September was flat at the midday break, at 1,045 stg, after ranging from 1,052 to 1,045 stg.

On Tuesday, New York cocoa futures retraced early losses, ending higher and toward the day's peaks on speculative short-covering. September rose $18 tonne, to $1,595, after ranging from $1,597 to $1,568. December ended $15 higher, at $1,643, while the remaining months finished up $11 to $32.
Technically, traders pegged September support at $1,575-$1,570. Near-term resistance at $1,600, with the next level seen at $1,610.
